unnormalised: Mumbai - Accurate inventory forecasting is becoming increasingly crucial for Indian manufacturers navigating complex supply chains and fluctuating demand, especially after recent disruptions. Experts at IIT-Delhi are highlighting the benefits of leveraging AI and machine learning for more precise predictions.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, a leading supply chain consultant in Chennai, explains that improved forecasting minimizes holding costs associated with excess inventory, freeing up valuable working capital that can be reinvested. For example, a garment manufacturer in Tirupur can use predictive analytics to anticipate demand for Diwali apparel, ensuring optimal stock levels and reducing wastage of unsold items.

unnormalised: Inefficient forecasting can lead to stockouts, causing production delays and lost sales, ultimately impacting profitability. Businesses operating in areas with fluctuating transport costs, like the Northeast, will find that robust inventory models are a lifesaver. Moreover, optimal inventory management saves on warehouse space (measured in sq ft) and reduces holding costs (often quantified in Rs.), benefitting overall operational efficiency. Proper planning ensures seamless operations from raw material procurement to finished product delivery. Ignoring it can create havoc!
